message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NA, cs.MS, cs.CE, cs.SE 

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the use of various parallel architectures (Intel KNLs, NVIDIA GPUs, and distributed-memory systems) for high performance computing in geospatial statistics. 
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper focuses on the evaluation of the Gaussian log-likelihood function, which involves solving a large dense covariance matrix using state-of-the-art high performance dense linear algebra libraries. 
- cs.MS (Mathematical Software): The paper presents a new software framework, ExaGeoStat, for geospatial statistics in climate and environment modeling. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper discusses the application of ExaGeoStat in climate and environmental science. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper presents a unified framework for geostatistics on manycore systems, which involves integrating various high performance computing technologies and libraries.
